comments.author: Fenke
comments.content:
i make a similar potato salad, i just use yoghurt instead of cream, leave out the gherkins and chop some arugula (or other herbs) very finely. yummy!
feta makes everything taste better :-)

comments.author: Apeksha
comments.content: Sounds like my favorite kind of potato salad.....creamy and herby! Love the idea of feta and cream instead of mayo!

comments.author: A&N
comments.content:
I love it. I hate the usual potato salad. I tried them once, the first day I landed in the US and I can't stand it.

I love how you've used feta because I think Mayo is the culprit in my case! And what a fab picture.

comments.author: Claudia
comments.content:
Dear,

Incredibly how things are. I have been blogging for a while and circulating around food blogs for some years now but never met your blog until today. I am totally in love with your beautiful blog and I am not a vegetarian at all. But you know that it definitely doesn't need a piece of meat on the plate to catch the eyes and hearts of the real food lovers...

Congrats, your blog is delicious.

Cláudia

comments.author: Carolyn Jung
comments.content: This sounds way better than your average potato salad. The feta is an inspired touch. It has so much more flavor than the usual mayo dressing.

comments.author: Kevin (Closet Cooking)
comments.content: This is one tasty sounding potato salad!  I certainly like the use of the feta! :)

comments.author: Sophia
comments.content: Wow, great job here. Awesome picture too! You should really consider submitting this to http://www.recipe4living.com/articles/the_perfect_potato_salad_recipe_contest.htm - Recipe4Living's Perfect Potato Salad Contest! It looks delicious!

comments.author: erin.meegan
comments.content: this seems like it would also be great warmed as a side or served room temp. at a party :)thanks for the recipe!
